label: [concatenate individualName (if provided), record/scientificName, record/materialSampleID]
description: [concatenate key:value pairs from other content in record/ that is not mapped, e.g. 'voucherCatalogNumber:USNM:Fish:433156'; record/preservative, ]
has_material_category: 'Organic material' unless record/entity, record/basisOfRecord, or record/collectionCode indicate otherwise
has_sample_object_type: 'Whole organism'  unless record/entity, record/basisOfRecord, or record/collectionCode indicate otherwise
informal_classification: record/scientificName or if that is missing, concat record/genus & record/specificEpithet

produced_by.label: concat parent/eventId & parent/expeditionCode
produced_by.description: concat other properties as key-value pairs: parent/samplingProtocol, parent/projectID
produced_by.has_feature_of_interest: [infer from specimen category, locality; need to so some unique values analysis]

responsibility.name: for each {name} in parent/principalInvestigator: 'principleInvestigator: & {name}'; for each {name} in record/identifiedBy 'identifiedBy: & {name}';  for each {name} in parent/taxteam 'taxonomy team: & {name}' for each {name} in parent/eventEnteredBy 'registrant: & {name}'

sampling_site.description: concatenate other stuff from parent.  Include min and max elevation if both present and not equal: 'elevation range:'& parent/maximumElevationInMeters &'-' & parent/maximumElevationInMeters. 'coordinate uncertainty:'& parent/coordinateUncertaintyInMeters.
sampling_site.label: parent/locality
place_name: parent/ -country, -county, -stateProvince, -continentOcean, -island, -islandGroup. Need to determine what are all the possible place name fields and set up partial order. Array of strings

curation.label: record/institutionCode [?this field should be where sample is stored/curated]
curation.curation_location: record/institutionCode [?this field should be where sample is stored/curated]

related_resource.label: child/entity
related_resource.relationship: if tissue, relation is 'tissue extract'; if photo, relation is 'image of'

related_resource.label: associated sequence
related_resource.target: associatedSequences, one relation for each sequence
